Getting to Know EWR Airport

Welcome to the Newark Liberty Airport Online Guide, your essential companion for navigating one of the busiest airports in the United States. Recognized for its impressive AirTrain system that provides seamless connectivity across all terminals, EWR ensures a hassle-free transit experience for all passengers. This guide offers a comprehensive overview of the airport's facilities, amenities, and services, aiming to make your journey through EWR smooth and enjoyable. For travelers keen on exploring more about other global airports, do visit our worldwide airport guide for valuable insights.

Airport News

Newark Liberty Airport (EWR) has seen several notable updates that will impact travelers. The airport's new $2.7 billion Terminal A has garnered another global award, highlighting its state-of-the-art facilities and design, enhancing the passenger experience significantly. Additionally, TSA checkpoints at Newark Liberty are now equipped with advanced computed tomography (CT) scanners, aiming to improve security and efficiency for travelers. These updates are part of the ongoing efforts to modernize and streamline operations at the airport, making it a more convenient and secure hub for passengers. Terminal A's global award and the new TSA checkpoints are pivotal in these improvements. (sources: NJ.com, TSA.gov)

Navigating EWR's Terminals

EWR Airport has three main terminals - Terminal A, Terminal B, and Terminal C. Terminal A has 29 gates and serves domestic flights for airlines such as Southwest and United. Terminal B has 26 gates and serves international flights for airlines such as Air Canada and Delta. Terminal C has 68 gates and serves both domestic and international flights for airlines such as American Airlines and JetBlue.

Each terminal has various amenities such as restaurants, shops, and lounges. Terminal C has the most options, including a duty-free store and a spa. If you need to transfer between terminals, there is an AirTrain that connects all three terminals and the parking lots. The AirTrain runs 24/7 and is free to use.

When you arrive at the airport, make sure to check your airline and terminal information beforehand to avoid any confusion. The airport also has helpful signage and staff to assist you with any questions or concerns.

Use our interactive airport map to locate food, services, and airline departure gates.

Connecting Between Terminals

The airport has three terminals: Terminal A, Terminal B, and Terminal C. To get between the terminals, passengers can use the AirTrain Newark, which is a free monorail system that operates 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. The AirTrain runs every 3 minutes during peak hours and every 15 minutes during off-peak hours. The travel time between terminals is approximately 10 minutes.

Passengers can also walk between the terminals, although the distance can be quite far. The walk time between Terminal A and Terminal C is approximately 15-20 minutes, and the walk time between Terminal B and Terminal C is approximately 10-15 minutes. For those who prefer not to walk, there is a shuttle bus service that operates between the terminals. The shuttle bus is also free and runs every 10-15 minutes.
